fact: On approaching the entrance of the Stellar Bay Apartments,
Talmadge Kerr will come running out of the door yelling about someone having been killed.
Talk to him to find out that the body is in the apartment on the lower right side of the building.
On the table is a note that can be examined.
Doing so will add the first objective to the quest log.
At the back of the apartment is a hastily-packed suitcase which can also be examined but won't progress the quest.
Head over to Left Field Tossball Betting and ask Nell about the betting slip found in the apartment.
She will reveal that the victim, Isaac, often placed bets on losing teams and started owing money to the wrong people.
She suspects that Isaac ran into trouble with Elijah and his buddies,
who usually loiter in the alley behind The Yacht Club,
and that Sanjar will be pleased if they are taken care of.
They make deliveries to the bays behind the warehouse and spend the rest of their time in the alley behind The Yacht Club.
Confronting Elijah about Isaac's murder will cause him to respond that no one has any proof.
With Intimidate 55 or Broken Tossball Stick found you can tell that he is wrong.
With second check of Intimidate 35, he and his gang will leave town.
Attempting to leave the conversation without passing the skill check and without stick will cause them to attack.
Elijah is accompanied by Berta and two thugs.
Elijah is SubLight contractor who can be found in Stellar Bay.
Elijah is a hooligan and bully from Fallbrook.
According to Nell, he and his buddies are known for dropping off supplies behind a warehouse and getting rowdy over tossball games,
so much so that he's not allowed in the bar anymore.
He usually loiters in the alley behind The Yacht Club.
Isaac Rose is a murder victim who can be found in the Stellar Bay Apartments.
He was an avid fan of tossball and had been known to go on hour-long rants about his favourite team, Mostly Colonists.
Left Field Tossball Betting is a location in Stellar Bay on Monarch.
Nell and other Stellar Bay residents watch tossball games here.
Nell is the proprietor of Left Field Tossball Betting in Stellar Bay.
Nell is a major tossball fan.
She is more interested in watching tossball than serving patrons.
She is happy to spend a large number of bits on related memorabilia and recently ordered a shipment of Tossball Jerseys to decorate her bar which has unfortunately gone missing.
To make up for the loss of the merchandise,
she has made an offer to Velma Ballard for a poster signed by Bertie "Black Hole" Holcomb which she plans to hang in her bar.
Sanjar Nandi is the current CEO of Monarch Stellar Industries, based in Stellar Bay.
Sanjar began working for MSI at a young age and it was there where he met Graham Bryant, who would eventually become his best friend.
Sanjar was ambitious but his attention to detail at the expense of big-picture thinking hampered his efforts within MSI.
This led to negative performance reviews regarding his tendency to pad reports and talks with numbers and data,
feedback which continues to haunt him many years on.
However, the negative feedback did not dampen Sanjar's desire to move up within the company,
even donating a kidney to one of the executives in hopes of promotion.
Despite his poor performance, Sanjar always showed himself to be a loyal employee of the company.
Despite Sanjar's best efforts, he has found it extremely challenging to continue operating MSI on Monarch without the backing of the Board.
In order to improve the lives of the people he is responsible for, Sanjar has a plan to rejoin the Board through the use of a BOLT-52 form and proof of another corporate presence on Monarch.
He is simultaneously working on a plan to reorganize the Board,
hoping that his plans are not found out until MSI has been reinstated.
Sanjar choosing to take over as head of MSI rather than dismantling it entirely caused a rift between him and Graham Bryant.
The latter started the Iconoclasts,
a group dedicated to spreading the word of Philosophism throughout the galaxy,
and Sanjar was left in Stellar Bay to run the company and look after the employees who were left behind.
He can also tell you more about the planet, that used to be called Terra 1
and the reform that he and Monarch Stellar Industries tried to achieve to give more humane working conditions for everyone within.
Outside the city walls, the lands were overrun by the native wildlife, as well as marauders and outlaws.
Stellar Bay is a company town located on the planet Monarch. It is owned and operated by Monarch Stellar Industries.
Stellar Bay is the largest saltuna producer on the Halcyon colony and used to be one of the most important suppliers of this resource.
Talmadge Kerr is a resident of Stellar Bay.
almadge cleans the Stellar Bay Apartments while the residents are at work.
He was therefore the first to find Isaac Rose's body after he had been murdered by Elijah.
After finding the body,
he ran out onto the the street yelling for help where the Stranger meets him.
He is very much traumatized by the ordeal.
Tossball is a sport in The Outer Worlds.
The Yacht Club is a bar in Stellar Bay.
